bship.logic

Class BattleShipServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • bship.logic.BattleShipServer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BattleShipServerTests

    public class BattleShipServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a the BattleShipServer. It is the system class that implements all the server general logic. It is the commander of the server and stores all the information necessary when the server is running. Contains the a main method that should be run to start the server.

      BattleShipServer constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BattleShipServer

        public BattleShipServer()
        BattleShipServer constructor. It is called to create by the main method to start the server.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
        Main method. Should be called to start the server.
        Parameters:
        argv - arguments to main function (unused).

      • getInLobbyPlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getInLobbyPlayers()
        Returns an ArrayList containing all players that are currently in lobby in the server, i. e., the players that are waiting for players to invite them or waiting to be invited to a game. A player is placed in lobby immediately after it successfully logs in to the server or when a game ends.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing all players that are currently in lobby in the server

      • playerLeftFromLobby

        public void playerLeftFromLobby(Player player)
        Is called to inform that a certain player has left from the lobby because the server needs to know when a player leaves from lobby. Receives the Player who left from lobby as parameter.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who left from lobby.

      • getInGamePlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getInGamePlayers()
        A getter method for the in game players. Returns and ArrayList containing all the players that are in game. It is used only by the tests package for validating that the information is well represented inside this class.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the players that are currently in game.

      • addInGamePlayer

        public void addInGamePlayer(Player player)
        Informs that a player has entered in a game. Is called by mathods of this package to inform so.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that has entered in game.

      • getOnlinePlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getOnlinePlayers()
        Returns an ArrayList containing wall the players that are currently online on the server. A player is online if it is in lobby, in ship placement or in game, i. e., if he is not offline.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the players that are currently online on the server.

      • getBattleshipPlayers

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Player> getBattleshipPlayers()
        Getter for all the BattleShip players, i. e., the ones that are registered on the server, despite of being online or offline.
        Returns:
        The HashMap containing all the registered players in the server.

      • newPlayerConnected

        public boolean newPlayerConnected(ClientThread thread,
                                  BattleShipData data)
        This method is called whenever the sockets class receive a new connection. It is called to inform the server that it needs to prepare the necessary resources to deal with that player and validate its login. If the login is valid, the player will be placed in the lobby. Receives as parameters the necessary information to communicate with the player and also to validate its login. Returns informing if the login was succeeded.
        Parameters:
        thread - The ClientThread class associated with the player. This class implements all sockets logic and is necessary for the server to communicate with the player that just connected.
        data - A BattleShipData class representing the data that the player sent to the server. It should be of type LoginRequestData because the first communication between the player and the server should be a request to login.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the login was succeeded or not.

      • sendOnlinePlayersInfoToPlayer

        public void sendOnlinePlayersInfoToPlayer(Player player)
        Responsible for sending the names of all players in lobby to a player.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to which the info should be sent.

      • sendOnlinePlayersInfoToAllPlayers

        public void sendOnlinePlayersInfoToAllPlayers()
        Responsible for sending the names of all players in lobby all players on the lobby.

      • playerDisconnected

        public void playerDisconnected(ClientThread thread)
        Responsible for handle a player disconnected, changing the player state to Offline and handling the effects of that player in other players (in case they are in game together)
        Parameters:
        thread - the thread that is communicating with the player that disconnected.

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
        Responsible for stop the server.

      • invitePlayer

        public boolean invitePlayer(java.lang.String inviterPlayerName,
                            java.lang.String invitedPlayerName)
        Responsable for invite a player, checking if the invited player is not busy.
        Parameters:
        inviterPlayerName - the name of the player that has made the invitation.
        invitedPlayerName - the name of the player that has been invited.
        Returns:
        true if invited. False otherwise.

      • canGameBeInitiated

        public boolean canGameBeInitiated(Player player1,
                                  Player player2)
        Checks if the game can be initiated by checking if both players are in state ReadyForGame.
        Parameters:
        player1 - One of the players that are in InShipPlacement.
        player2 - The other player that are in InShipPlacement.
        Returns:
        true if can be initiated. False otherwise.
